title: Historic Charlton Park
text:
Historic Charlton Park is a historically oriented local facility and museum in <a href="Barry%20County%2C%20Michigan">Barry County, Michigan</a>, that sits on along the <a href="Thornapple%20River">Thornapple River</a>.
The village is made up of a number of nineteenth and early-twentieth century structures that have been brought together from around the county to recreate a <a href="Michigan">Michigan</a> village from the turn of the 20th century. Buildings include a <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a>'s home, <a href="blacksmith">blacksmith</a> shop, <a href="bank">bank</a> and <a href="insurance%20office">insurance office</a>, <a href="barber">barber shop</a>, <a href="inn">inn</a> and <a href="stagecoach">stagecoach</a> stop, <a href="church%20%28building%29">Church</a>, <a href="carpenter">carpenter</a>/cooper shop, <a href="carriage%20house">carriage house</a>,
<a href="general%20store">general store</a>, <a href="hardware%20store">hardware store</a>, <a href="school">school</a>, <a href="printer%20%28publishing%29">printshop</a>, <a href="Log%20cabin">cabin</a>, <a href="sawmill">sawmill</a>, and the Hastings Township Hall. 
Besides the historic village and museum, there is a swimming beach on the Thornapple River, along which the park is located.
